projectData.description: The website you're currently visiting. Created with Vite and ReactJS. Configured to be hosted on GitHub Pages. JSON is used to dynamically render the pages.
React JS application I developed for an assessment.

screenshotsJpgData.maoriPlacenamesQuestion: The history table automatically builds as the user answers questions.

screenshotsGifData.maoriPlacenamesAnsweringQuestion: Dynamic CSS styling and Randomized prompts / messages as the user plays the game to enhance the user experience.
screenshotsGifData.maoriAppTests: Unit and Integration testing was implemented with Jest.

projectData.description: My First App in ASP.NET. Styled with CSS.

screenshotsJpgData.carpetApp: The results section remains hidden until submit clicked.

screenshotsGifData.carpetAppTests: This App implemented unit testing with xUnit.

projectData.description: My second App in ASP.NET. Practicing the programming design pattern "Factory Method".

screenshotsGifData.pizzaApp: Dynamically loads the right information using Factory Method logic.

projectData.description: An application created to practice ASP.NET MVC (Model-View-Controller) with a full database CRUD (CREATE, READ, UPDATE, DELETE).

screenshotsJpgData.bikeShopRolesClaimsPermissions: Roles and Claims logic was implemented to manage user account permissions.

screenshotsGifData.bikeShopApp: Built with ASP.NET MVC and T-SQL Server Management Studio.

projectData.description: This App uses an API from TMDB (The Movie Database).

screenshotsJpgData.movieAPIApp: This app also utilises T-SQL database for dynamic pages.

projectData.description: User interface design prototype for the backend management of Staff Members at Ensight NZ. I built this application in ASP.NET with Database to implement mockdata I created at mockaroo for better testing. Interfaces for full database CRUD were developed.

screenshotsGifData.ensightStaffInterfaceAccordion: Bootstrap Accordions were implemented to make the most of limited space.

projectData.description: A mobile app which helps to teach beginners in Japanese the Hiragana and Katakana alphabets. It uses an API to implement a Japanese/English Dictionary and an SQLite Database to track the users progress.

screenshotsJpgData.koolKanaMainMenu: Main Menu of my Kool Kana app.
screenshotsJpgData.aboutScreenKoolKana: About Screen for the Kool Kana app.

screenshotsGifData.japaneseAPIDictionary: Dictionary Implemented with API, to search with Japanese or English words.

projectData.description: My first live website, developed for a student assignment. Hosted with Plesk. Various technologies used such as SQL.

screenshotsJpgData.carlandApp: Bootstrap cards were used with CSS to create a clean responsive layout.

projectData.description: Another website student project similar to the above but implemented with additional features such as more filtering controls, video, and informational pages.

screenshotsJpgData.kawasakiApp: Taking advantage of prior code and spending time to develop additional new features.
